questions.title: House Robber (DP)
questions.prompt: Given an integer array `nums` representing the amount of money of each house, determine the maximum amount of money you can rob tonight without alerting the police (cannot rob two adjacent houses).
followups: What is the DP recurrence relation?
How do you optimize space to O(1)?
What if the houses are arranged in a circle (House Robber II)?

questions.title: Binary Tree Boundary Traversal
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, print all the boundary nodes in anti-clockwise order starting from the root. Boundary includes left boundary (excluding leaves), leaves, and right boundary (excluding leaves) in reverse order.
followups: How do you handle a single node tree?
What is the time and space complexity?
How would you modify this for a N-ary tree?

questions.title: Minimum Window Substring
questions.prompt: Given two strings `s` and `t`, return the minimum window substring of `s` such that every character in `t` (including duplicates) is included in the window. If there is no such substring, return an empty string.
followups: What invariant does your sliding window maintain?
What is the time and space complexity?
How would you handle very large strings (streaming)?

questions.title: Subsequence Removal (Unique Integers)
questions.prompt: Given an array of unique integers, you repeatedly remove a subsequence and append it to the result. The removed subsequence must be strictly increasing. What is the minimum number of operations required to remove all elements?
followups: How does the algorithm change if duplicates are allowed?
Can you solve this in O(n) time?
What is the connection to patience sorting (LIS)?

questions.title: Next Greater Even Number (Same Digits)
questions.prompt: Given an integer, generate the smallest even number that is strictly larger than the given number and uses the exact same digits. If no such number exists, return -1.
followups: How is this related to the next permutation problem?
What edge cases (leading zeros, large numbers) must you handle?
What is the time complexity?

questions.title: Rotate Matrix 90 Degrees (In-Place)
questions.prompt: Given an N x N 2D matrix, rotate it by 90 degrees clockwise in-place.
followups: What is the space complexity of the transpose + reverse method?
How would you rotate a non-square (M x N) matrix?
How do you rotate counter-clockwise?

questions.title: Spiral Matrix
questions.prompt: Given an m x n matrix, return all elements of the matrix in spiral order.
followups: How do you manage the boundary conditions?
What is the time complexity?
How would you generate a spiral matrix given n?

questions.title: Remove Nth Node From End of List
questions.prompt: Given the head of a linked list, remove the nth node from the end of the list and return its head. Do it in one pass.
followups: Why does the two-pointer (fast-slow) approach work?
How do you handle the case where n equals the length of the list (removing the head)?
What is the time and space complexity?

questions.title: BFS: Find N-Degree Friends
questions.prompt: Given a social network graph (adjacency list) and a starting user, find all users who are exactly 'N' degrees of connection away (i.e., N-degree friends).
followups: Why is BFS more suitable than DFS for this problem?
How do you prevent revisiting nodes (cycles)?
What is the time complexity in terms of V and E?

questions.title: LFU Cache (Least Frequently Used)
questions.prompt: Design and implement a data structure for a Least Frequently Used (LFU) cache. Implement `get(key)` and `put(key, value)`. When the cache reaches capacity, it should invalidate the least frequently used item. If there is a tie, the least recently used item among them should be removed.
followups: What is the time complexity of your get and put operations?
How do you maintain frequency counts efficiently?
How does this differ from LRU cache?

questions.title: Sort HashMap by Value
questions.prompt: Given a HashMap<String, Integer>, sort the map by its values in ascending or descending order. Write the code.
followups: How do you sort a Map using Streams in Java 8+?
What is the time complexity?
Can you sort a HashMap directly? Why not?

questions.title: Immutable Class in Java
questions.prompt: How do you make a class immutable in Java? Provide a step-by-step example.
followups: Why are immutable objects thread-safe?
What are the requirements for an immutable class?
How do you handle mutable fields like Date or List?

questions.title: Low-Level Design: Office Printer Queue
questions.prompt: Design a printer queue system for an office with four floors, each having four printers. There are two types of printers: Color and B&W. A B&W printer can only print B&W jobs, but a Color printer can print both color and B&W jobs. A printer queue should not have more than N jobs. Implement the core logic.
followups: What data structures would you use to manage the queues?
How do you balance the load between printers on the same floor?
How would you prioritize jobs (e.g., urgent vs normal)?

questions.title: Real-Life Scenario: Elevator/Lift System Design
questions.prompt: Design an elevator control system for a building with 3 lifts and a single call button on each floor. How do you prioritize which lift should respond to a call? Consider factors like distance, direction, and current load.
followups: What data structure would you use to represent the state of each lift?
How do you handle multiple requests simultaneously?
What algorithm minimizes average waiting time?

questions.title: SQL: Query with Complex Aggregation
questions.prompt: Given a table `Transactions(account_id, transaction_date, amount)`, write a SQL query to find the top 3 accounts with the highest total transaction amount in the last 30 days.
followups: How do you handle ties in the top 3?
What indexes would you add to optimize this query?
How would you write this as a window function (RANK/DENSE_RANK)?

questions.title: OS: Deadlock Conditions
questions.prompt: What are the four necessary conditions for a deadlock to occur? Explain each.
followups: How does the Banker's algorithm prevent deadlock?
What is deadlock avoidance vs detection vs recovery?
How do you prevent deadlock in a Java multithreaded application?

questions.title: Concurrency: Find Maximum in Matrix with Threads
questions.prompt: Given a large random matrix, how would you find the maximum element using multiple threads? Explain your design.
followups: How do you divide the matrix among threads?
How do you aggregate the results from each thread?
What is the trade-off between number of threads and performance?

questions.title: Distributed Tracing in Microservices
questions.prompt: How do you track a single request as it travels across multiple microservices? What is distributed tracing and how is it implemented?
followups: What is a Correlation ID?
How do tools like Jaeger or Zipkin work?
What information should be included in the trace context?

questions.title: API Gateway Responsibilities
questions.prompt: What is an API Gateway and what are its primary responsibilities in a microservices architecture?
followups: How does it differ from a load balancer?
What is rate limiting and how would you implement it?
How does an API Gateway handle authentication?

questions.title: Spring vs Spring Boot
questions.prompt: What is the difference between Spring Framework and Spring Boot? Why would you choose one over the other?
followups: What are Spring Boot starters?
What is auto-configuration and how does it work?
What is the purpose of application.properties?

questions.title: Behavioral: Reaction to Not Being Promoted
questions.prompt: Imagine you have been working very hard, but you are not promoted. You see your junior colleague getting promoted. How would you react and what would you do?
followups: Would you confront your manager?
How do you seek feedback on your performance?
What steps would you take to improve your chances next time?

questions.title: Behavioral: Reporting to a Junior
questions.prompt: How would you feel if you were asked to report to someone who joined the company after you or has less experience than you?
followups: How do you handle your ego in such a situation?
What if you disagree with their technical decisions?
How do you continue to grow and contribute?
